alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:57AM CDT until June 03 at 12:08PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Benton, Camden and Morgan. In west central Missouri, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 857 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Big Buffalo Creek at Highway WW, Rainy Creek at Knobby Road, Monegaw Creek at NW 1301 Road, Turkey Creek at Jackman Avenue and Deer Creek at Highway V. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warsaw, Lincoln, Appleton City, Cole Camp, Lowry City, Climax Springs, Whitakerville and Racket. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
